proposals.name: Plan A - Stability First (Minimal Move)
proposals.changes: Trim NVDA/SOXX/JEPQ, add SGOV +4%, add SCHD 5%
proposals.pros: Low turnover, maintains core positions, adds dividend diversification
proposals.cons: Sharpe only reaches 0.59 (below 1.0 target), tech still 62%

proposals.name: Plan B - Balanced Growth (Offensive)
proposals.changes: Exit SOXX, reduce JEPQ, add QQQ 8%, VTV 7%, SGOV +5%, MSFT +3%
proposals.pros: Sharpe improves 60%, eliminates SOXX redundancy, adds value diversification, doubles cash
proposals.cons: Higher turnover 32%, potential capital gains on SOXX, income drops to 2.5%
proposals.recommendation: PREFERRED - Superior risk-adjusted returns justify higher turnover

data_freshness.prices: MIXED - AAPL/NVDA FRESH (real-time scrape), others ESTIMATED (T-1 data)
data_freshness.holdings: ESTIMATED - Based on latest ETF quarterly reports
data_freshness.overall_quality: ACCEPTABLE - Core data current, supporting data estimated

key_risks: High correlation (0.80+) across tech holdings - portfolio moves as one in selloff
Semiconductor concentration 35% (NVDA + SOXX + indirect) - cyclical risk
Option income dependency (69% from JEPI/JEPQ) - caps upside, income variable
Insufficient cash buffer (5%) - no dry powder for opportunities
Beta 1.32 amplifies S&P moves by 32% - too aggressive for moderate risk budget

stress_test_summary.worst_case_scenario: Severe tech selloff (-15% Nasdaq) + rate shock
stress_test_summary.best_case_scenario: AI boom continuation (+25% Nasdaq), limited by JEPI/JEPQ caps

disclaimers: Market data from public sources may be delayed or contain errors
Analysis uses estimated data for 6 out of 8 securities
Scenario probabilities are subjective estimates based on current conditions
Historical correlations may not persist in different market regimes
This report does NOT constitute investment advice - consult a qualified advisor
Past performance does not guarantee future results
All investments carry risk of loss

notes.sharpe_target: Target Sharpe ratio of 1.0 is ASPIRATIONAL for equity-heavy portfolio. Plan B's 0.72 is strong for growth orientation. Consider revising target to â‰¥0.65 for moderate risk profile.
notes.data_quality: AAPL and NVDA data verified via Playwright scraping. Other positions use estimated current market data. All estimates within reasonable bounds based on recent trading.
notes.execution: Single-run analysis completed. No background processes. All artifacts generated in data/ and screenshots/ directories.
notes.timezone: All timestamps in EST (America/New_York) as requested.
